In alcuni monasteri, i monaci erano completamente silenziosi e non erano permesse visite dall'esterno per non interrompere i rituali quotidiani e le cerimonie religiose.[PARAGRAPH:1] Nel corso dei secoli, i monasteri sono stati spesso centro di insegnamento: in alcune zone, i monaci erano sovente gli unici in grado di leggere e scrivere nel giro di diversi chilometri. Da sempre, i monaci sono stati utilizzati come scribi per copiare le parole sacre della propria religione; i monasteri ospitavano spesso delle biblioteche che contenevano testi religiosi, scientifici, medici e filosofici.[PARAGRAPH:1]Il primo monastero Cristiano venne fondato da Sant'Antonio in Egitto, intorno al 300 d. C. L'idea si diffuse in tutto il mondo Cristiano ed è possibile trovare monasteri nell'Africa Settentrionale, nel Medio Oriente, nell'Asia Occidentale e in Europa. La Chiesa Romana Cattolica era composta da dozzine di ordini monastici che comprendevano Benedettini, Francescani, Gesuiti, Carmelitani, Trappisti, Agostiniani e Cavalieri Templari.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Un monasterio es un edificio en el que los monjes pueden retirarse del mundo para concentrarse en los asuntos de la divinidad. Normalmente tienen estrictas reglas de comportamiento para proteger a sus miembros de la tentación. En algunos monasterios, los monjes guardan un silencio total, mientras que en otros no se permite el acceso a los visitantes. Lo habitual es que sus miembros tengan que celebrar a diario muchos rituales y servicios religiosos.[PARAGRAPH:1] A lo largo de la historia, los monasterios han sido muchas veces centros de estudio. En las regiones remotas, los monjes podían ser las únicas personas letradas en muchos kilómetros a la redonda. A menudo han sido empleados como escribas, y se han dedicado a copiar los textos sagrados de su religión. Normalmente cuentan con grandes bibliotecas, que contienen textos religiosos, científicos, médicos y filosóficos.[PARAGRAPH:1]El primer monasterio del que se tiene noticia fue fundado por san Antonio en Egipto, alrededor del año 300 d. C. La idea se propagó por el mundo cristiano y, al cabo de algún tiempo, había monasterios cristianos en África del norte, Oriente Medio, Asia occidental y Europa. La Iglesia Católica Romana cuenta con docenas de órdenes monásticas, incluidas la benedictina, la franciscana, la jesuita, la carmelita, la trapista, la agustiniana y la de los caballeros templarios.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Church of the Holy Sepulchre also called the Basilica of the Holy Sepulchre, or the Church of the Resurrection by Eastern Christians, is a church within the Christian Quarter of the walled Old City of Jerusalem. It is a few steps away from the Muristan.[PARAGRAPH:1]The site is venerated as Calvary (Golgotha), where Jesus was crucified, and also contains the place where Jesus is said to have been buried. The church has been an important Christian pilgrimage destination since at least the 4th century as the purported site of the resurrection of Jesus.[PARAGRAPH:1]Today it also serves as the headquarters of the Greek Orthodox Patriarch of Jerusalem, while control of the building is shared between several Christian churches and secular entities in complicated arrangements essentially unchanged for centuries. Today, the church is home to branches of Eastern Orthodoxy and Oriental Orthodoxy as well as to Roman Catholicism. Anglicans and Protestants have no permanent presence in the Church and some have regarded the Garden Tomb, elsewhere in Jerusalem, as the true place of Jesus's crucifixion and resurrection.

[TAB]A church, is a building used for religious activities, particularly worship services. The term in its architectural sense is most often used by Christians to refer to their religious buildings but can be used by other religions. In traditional Christian architecture, the church is often arranged in the shape of a Christian cross. When viewed from plan view the longest part of a cross is represented by the aisle and the junction of the cross is located at the altar area. Towers or domes are often added with the intention of directing the eye of the viewer towards the heavens and inspiring church visitors. Modern church buildings have a variety of architectural styles and layouts; many buildings that were designed for other purposes have now been converted for church use; and, similarly, many original church buildings have been put to other uses. The earliest identified Christian church was founded between 233 and 256. During the 11th through 14th centuries, a wave of building of cathedrals and smaller parish churches occurred across Western Europe.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Persécutés par les Romains, les premiers chrétiens pratiquent leur religion en secret dans des maisons privées, des catacombes et d'autres lieux de ce genre. En 325 ap. J.-C., l'empereur Constantin Ier légalise le christianisme. Alors qu'il n'est lui-même pas chrétien, Constantin Ier construit de nombreuses églises chrétiennes sur le territoire romain, et notamment la Basilique de la Nativité à Bethléem. De nombreux chrétiens considèrent qu'elle est construite à l'emplacement même de la naissance de Jésus.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Angesichts der Verfolgung durch die Römer beteten die ersten Christen meist in ihren Häusern, in Katakomben oder an anderen abgeschiedenen Orten. Kaiser Konstantin legalisierte im Jahr 325 das Christentum und ließ zahlreiche christliche Kirchen, wie die Geburtskirche in Bethlehem, errichten. Letztere wurde am angeblichen Geburtsort Christi erbaut.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]In seguito alla persecuzione dei Romani, i primi Cristiani pregavano in posti segreti e nascosti nelle proprie abitazioni o in catacombe. l'Imperatore Costantino I legalizzò il Cristianesimo nel 325 d. C. Malgrado non fosse Cristiano, Costantino I fece costruire molte chiese su tutto il territorio Romano, inclusa la Chiesa della Natività a Betlemme, dove molti Cristiani credano sia nato Gesù Cristo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Acosados por la persecución de los romanos, los primitivos cristianos celebraban sus ceremonias en la privacidad de sus casas, en catacumbas y lugares parecidos. El emperador Constantino I legalizó el Cristianismo en el año 325 d. C. Aunque él mismo, a diferencia de lo que suele afirmarse, no era cristiano, erigió muchas iglesias por todo el territorio romano, incluida la de la Natividad, en Belén, que, según creen muchos cristianos, es el lugar en el que nació Jesús.

TEXT.English: [TAB]"Dun" is a Celtic word meaning, "hill-fort." The Celts began constructing duns around the seventh century BC, and remnants can be found scattered across Western Europe, England, Scotland and Ireland. Duns were typically small, squat towers constructed of dry-laid stone on raised, defensible terrain such as hills and promontories. Some were surrounded by ditches or artificial lakes.[PARAGRAPH:1]While many hill-forts were primitive and quite small, more extensive and complex Celtic duns have also been discovered. One such example is "Dun Carloway," on the Isle of Lewis, Scotland. This double-walled castle-like structure originally stood some thirteen meters high and fourteen meters in diameter. Maiden Castle in Dorset, England, is an extensive wall and ditch work surmounting a large hill some 47 acres in size.
TEXT.French: [TAB]"Dun" est un terme celte signifiant "fort sur une colline" (plus connu sous son nom latin "oppidum"). Les Celtes entreprennent la construction d'oppida vers le VIIe siècle av. J.-C.. Il est encore possible d'en trouver des vestiges de nos jours en Europe de l'Ouest, en Angleterre, en Ecosse et en Irlande. Les oppida sont généralement de petites tours trapues construites sur les pierres sèches d'un terrain surélevé et défendable tel qu'une colline ou un promontoire. Certains sont entourés de rigoles ou de lacs artificiels.[PARAGRAPH:1]Même si la plupart des fortifications sont rudimentaires et de petites tailles, des oppida plus grands et plus complexes ont été également été découverts, notamment le broch de "Dun Carloway" sur l'île de Lewis en Ecosse. Cette structure similaire à un château qui se démarque par sa double muraille fait près de treize mètres de haut et de quatorze mètres de diamètre. Maiden Castle, à Dorset en Angleterre, est un fort impressionnant entouré de remparts et de douves, au sommet d'une immense colline de près de 47 acres.
TEXT.German: [TAB]"Dun" ist das keltische Wort für "Hügelfestung". Die Kelten begannen um das 7. Jahrhundert mit der Errichtung dieser Duns und noch heute sind Überreste davon in Westeuropa, England, Schottland und Irland zu finden. Duns (auch Brochs) waren üblicherweise kleine, niedrige Türme aus Trockenmauerwerk, die auf erhöhtem, gut zu verteidigendem Gelände, wie zum Beispiel Hügeln oder kleineren Bergen, errichtet wurden. Manche waren auch von Wassergräben oder künstlichen Seen umgeben.[PARAGRAPH:1]Viele dieser Hügelfestungen waren eher primitiv und sehr klein, mittlerweile wurden aber auch größere, komplexere keltische Duns entdeckt. Ein Beispiel für ein solches Bauwerk ist "Dun Carloway" auf der Isle of Lewis in Schottland, ein doppelwandiges Gebäude, das ursprünglich etwa 13 Meter hoch war und im Durchmesser 14 Meter maß. Auch "Maiden Castle" in Dorset, England, ist ein gutes Beispiel für eine Hügelfestung. In diesem Fall besteht die Festungsanlage allerdings aus Erdwällen und Gräben, die sich über eine etwa 5 Hektar große Anhöhe erstrecken.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]"Dun" è una parola celtica che significa "collina fortificata". I Celti cominciarono a costruire dun nel settimo secolo a.C. e ancora oggi se ne possono ammirare i resti in tutta l'Europa occidentale, in Inghilterra, in Scozia e in Irlanda. I dun erano delle torri piccole e massicce costruiti con pietre essiccate su terreni difendibili come colline e promontori. Alcuni erano circondati da fossati o laghi artificiali.[PARAGRAPH:1]Anche se molti dun erano primitivi e piuttosto piccoli, ne sono stati scoperti anche di più vasti e complessi. Uno di questi è il "Dun Carloway", nell'isola di Lewis (Scozia). Questa struttura simile a un castello dalle doppie mura originariamente si ergeva per oltre tredici metri in altezza e quattordici di diametro. Il Maiden Castle nel Dorset (Inghilterra) è un'altra fortificazione con fossati e mura per 47 acri in cima a una collina.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]"Dun" es una palabra celta que significa "fuerte en colina". Los celtas empezaron a construir duns alrededor del s. VII a. C. y se pueden encontrar restos de ellos esparcidos por Europa Occidental, Inglaterra, Escocia e Irlanda. Los duns eran normalmente torres pequeñas y compactas, construidas con piedra encajada sin argamasa y en terrenos defendibles y elevados, como colinas y promontorios. Algunos estaban rodeados de fosos o lagos artificiales.[PARAGRAPH:1]Aunque muchos "fuertes en colina" eran primitivos y bastante pequeños, se han descubierto duns celtas más grandes y complejos. Uno de ellos es Dun Carloway, en la isla de Lewis, Escocia. Esta estructura de doble muralla y similar a un castillo tenía originalmente trece metros de altura y catorce de diámetro. Maiden Castle, en Dorset, Inglaterra, es una gran obra de murallas y fosos que corona una gran colina de unas 19 hectáreas de extensión.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An observatory is a structure which helps men to study the night skies. While modern observatories are equipped with mighty telescopes allowing astronomers to probe the origins of the universe, the earliest were little more than rooms or platforms open to the sky, from which the primitive astronomers - often priests or astrologers - tracked the movement of the stars with their naked eyes.[PARAGRAPH:2]The early Celts were enthusiastic astronomers. After countless years of patient observation they were able to chart and predict the movements of many celestial bodies. The movement of the stars had religious and magical significance, but were also of immense practical use, as well: by charting the progress of the night sky one could construct a very accurate calendar, which was extremely useful for determining the correct time to plant and harvest crops.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un observatoire est une structure qui aide les hommes à étudier le ciel, la nuit. Alors que les observatoires modernes sont équipés de puissants télescopes permettant aux astronomes d'explorer les origines de l'univers, les premiers n'étaient rien de plus que des pièces ou des plates-formes à ciel ouvert, à partir desquelles les premiers astronomes, souvent des prêtres ou des astrologues, suivaient les mouvements des astres à l'oeil nu.[PARAGRAPH:2]Les premiers Celtes étaient de fervents astronomes. Après d'innombrables années de patientes observations, ils étaient en mesure de tracer et de prévoir les déplacements de nombreux corps célestes. Le mouvement des étoiles avait une signification religieuse et magique, mais il était également d'une très grande utilité : en traçant l'évolution du ciel nocturne, on pouvait établir un calendrier très précis, extrêmement utile pour déterminer la période idéale pour semer et récolter les cultures.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Observatorium ermöglicht den Menschen die Beobachtung und das Studium des Nachthimmels. Während moderne Observatorien mit riesigen Teleskopen ausgestattet sind, mit deren Hilfe die Astronomen den Ursprung des Universums erforschen, wurden die frühesten Anlagen dieser Art in etwas größeren Räumen oder auf Plattformen unter freiem Himmel aufgestellt, von wo aus die ersten Sternenkundler - meist Priester oder Astrologen - die Fortbewegung der Himmelskörper mit bloßem Auge beobachteten und aufzeichneten.[PARAGRAPH:2]Insbesondere die keltischen Stämme der Antike waren begeisterte Sternkundler. Nach zahllosen Jahren geduldiger Beobachtungsarbeit gelang es ihnen schließlich sogar, die Konstellationen und Bewegungsabläufe vieler Himmelskörper zu kartografieren und vorherzusagen. Den Sternen und ihren jeweiligen Positionen wurde nicht nur religiöse und magische Bedeutung beigemessen, darüber hinaus dienten sie auch praktischen Anwendungen: Durch die Kartografierung des sich verändernden Nachthimmels konnte ein sehr genauer Kalender erstellt werden, der vor allem für die Bestimmung der richtigen Pflanz- und Erntezeiten extrem hilfreich war.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Gli osservatori sono strutture che permettono uno studio più preciso del cielo notturno. Mentre gli osservatori moderni sono dotati di telescopi che permettono agli astronomi di sondare il cosmo alla ricerca della sua origine, quelli dell'antichità erano poco più che stanze o piattaforme aperte al cielo, dalle quali gli astronomi del tempo, spesso sacerdoti o astrologi, seguivano il percorso degli astri a occhio nudo.[PARAGRAPH:2]I Celti delle origini erano degli astronomi entusiasti. Dopo innumerevoli anni di pazienti osservazioni, furono in grado di predire gli spostamenti di numerosi corpi celesti. Il cammino delle stelle possedeva un significato religioso e magico, ma la sua conoscenza era anche di enorme valore pratico: prendendo nota dei cambiamenti del cielo notturno era possibile creare un calendario molto accurato, utile soprattutto per stabilire quale fosse il momento più propizio per la semina e il raccolto.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Un observatorio es una estructura que ayuda a estudiar el firmamento. Aunque los observatorios modernos están equipados con potentes telescopios que permiten a los astrónomos estudiar los orígenes del universo, los más primitivos solo eran habitaciones o plataformas abiertas al cielo desde la que estos primeros astrónomos, a menudo sacerdotes o astrólogos, seguían el movimiento de las estrellas con la vista.[PARAGRAPH:2]Los antiguos celtas eran astrónomos entusiastas. Tras incontables años de paciente observación, pudieron cartografiar y predecir el movimiento de los cuerpos celestes. El movimiento de las estrellas tenía un significado religioso y mágico, pero era también de enorme utilidad práctica: cartografiando los cambios del firmamento uno podía construir un calendario muy preciso, que resultaba muy útil para determinar el momento idóneo para plantar y recoger las cosechas.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The European Organization for Nuclear Research (French: Organisation européenne pour la recherche nucléaire), known as CERN or Cern is an international organization whose purpose is to operate the world's largest particle physics laboratory, in the northwest suburbs of Geneva on the Franco-Swiss border. Established in 1954, the organization has 20 European member states.[PARAGRAPH:1]The term CERN is also used to refer to the laboratory, which employs just under 2,400 full-time employees, 1,500 part-time employees, and hosts some 10,000 visiting scientists and engineers, representing 608 universities and research facilities and 113 nationalities.[PARAGRAPH:1]CERN's main function is to provide the particle accelerators and other infrastructure needed for high-energy physics research. Numerous experiments have been constructed at CERN by international collaborations to make use of them. It is also the birthplace of the World Wide Web. The main site at Meyrin also has a large computer center containing very powerful data-processing facilities primarily for experimental data analysis and, because of the need to make them available to researchers elsewhere, has historically been a major wide area networking hub.

[TAB]The Channel Tunnel (French: le tunnel sous la Manche) is a 31 mile (50.5 km)-long rail tunnel beneath the English Channel at the Straits of Dover, connecting Folkestone, Kent in England to Coquelles near Calais in northern France. A long-standing and very expensive megaproject that saw several false starts, it was finally completed in 1994. It is the second-longest rail tunnel in the world, with the Seikan Tunnel in Japan being longer, but the undersea section of 24 miles (39 km) is the longest of its kind in the world.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le tunnel sous la Manche est un tunnel ferroviaire long de 49,7 km, qui effectue la liaison entre Coquelles (près de Calais) dans le Nord de la France et Folkestone dans le Kent, en Angleterre. Après avoir été plusieurs fois abandonné, ce projet colossal au budget faramineux fut finalement achevé en 1994. Le tunnel sous la Manche est le deuxième plus grand tunnel au monde, le premier étant le tunnel du Seikan au Japon. Sa section sous la mer (37,3 km) est toutefois la plus longue au monde.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Eurotunnel oder Kanaltunnel ist ein 50 km langer Eisenbahntunnel, der unterhalb des Ärmelkanals an der Meerenge von Dover verläuft. Er verbindet Folkeston in Kent (England) und Coquelle nahe Calais in Nordfrankreich. Das langwierige und äußerst kostspielige Mega-Bauprojekt, dem einige fehlgeschlagene Tunnelbauversuche vorangingen, wurde schließlich 1994 vollendet. Der Tunnel ist nach dem Seikan-Tunnel in Japan der zweitlängste Eisenbahntunnel der Welt, wobei der 37,9 Kilometer lange unterseeische Tunnelabschnitt bislang weltweit unübertroffen ist.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il canale della Manica (in francese: le tunnel sous la Manche) è un tunnel lungo 50,5 km che passa sotto la manica all'altezza dello stretto di Dover e collega Folkestone, Kent in Inghilterra con Coquelles, vicino a Calais nella Francia settentrionale. Si tratta di un mega progetto che è rimasto in ballo molto tempo e ha avuto molte false partenze, ed è stato finalmente completato nel 1994. È il secondo tunnel ferroviario più lungo al mondo: è superato solo dal tunnel Seikan in Giappone, ma la sezione subacquea di 39 km è la più lunga al mondo, nel suo genere.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El Eurotúnel es un túnel de cincuenta kilómetros y medio que recorre el subsuelo del Canal de la Mancha y que conecta Folkestone, Kent, en Inglaterra, con Coquelles, cerca de Calais, en el norte de Francia. Se trata de un largo y caro proyecto que, tras varias salidas en falso, fue finalmente terminado en 1994. Es el segundo túnel para transporte ferroviario más largo del mundo, después del Túnel Seikan japonés. Sin embargo, su sección submarina, de 39 kilómetros, es la más larga del mundo.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Temple of Kukulkan (also known as El Castillo or the Temple of Quetzalcoatl) is one of the best-known Mayan buildings in Chichen Itza. The structure itself is a typical four-sided step temple, but at its base rests stone pillars carved with feathered serpents (revealing the strong Toltec/Aztec influence). Many archeologists believe that its design is based upon the Mayan calendar, since each stairway has 90 steps. Add the total steps to the number of stairways plus the top platform, and you reach the number of 365 (the number of days in [our] typical calendar year).
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le temple de Quetzalcóatl (aussi appelé la Citadelle ou le temple de Kukulcán) est l'un des bâtiments mayas les plus connus sur le site de Chichén Itzá. L'ouvrage est une simple pyramide à degrés à quatre côtés, mais on trouve à sa base des piliers en pierre sur lesquels sont gravés des serpents à plumes, révélant la forte influence toltèque et aztèque. Beaucoup d'archéologues pensent que ce temple fut conçu d'après le calendrier maya, car chaque escalier compte 90 marches. Si l'on fait le total des marches et des escaliers, et qu'on ajoute la plate-forme au sommet, on obtient le nombre 365, soit le nombre de jours d'une année civile classique.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Pyramide des Kukulcán (auch El Castillo oder Tempel des Quetzalcoatl genannt) ist eines der bekanntesten Maya-Bauwerke in Chichen Itza. Das Gebäude selbst ist eine typische vierseitige Stufenpyramide, an deren Fuß allerdings Steinsäulen mit eingemeißelten gefiederten Schlangen angebracht sind (was den starken toltekischen/aztekischen Einfluss widerspiegelt). Viele Archäologen glauben, dass dieses Design auf dem Maya-Kalender basiert, da jeder Treppenabschnitt 90 Stufen hat. Addiert man die Gesamtzahl der Stufen und zählt dann die Anzahl der Treppenabschnitte plus der Dachplattform hinzu, so erhält man die Zahl 365 (die Anzahl der Tage in [unserem] gewöhnlichen Kalenderjahr).
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il Tempio di Kukulcan (conosciuto anche come El Castillo o Tempio di Quetzalcoatl) è uno degli edifici maya meglio conosciuti di Chichen Itza. La struttura è quella tipica di un tempo con quattro lati, ma alla base si trovano colonne di pietra scolpite con serpenti piumati (che rivelano la forte influenza tolteca/azteca). Molti archeologi credono che il progetto si basi sul calendario maya, visto che ogni scala ha 90 scalini. Sommando il numero di scalini delle quattro scale a quelli della piattaforma sovrastante si ottiene 365 (il numero di giorni nel [nostro] anno).
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El Templo de Kukulcán (también conocido como "El Castillo" o el "Templo de Quetzalcoatl") es uno de los edificios mayas más conocidos de Chichen Itzá. La estructura en sí es un templo típico con cuatro paredes inclinadas y con escalones, pero en su base descansan unos pilares de piedra grabados con serpientes emplumadas (lo cual evidencia la fuerte influencia tolteca/azteca). Muchos arqueólogos creen que su diseño está basado en el calendario maya, pues todas las escaleras tienen noventa peldaños. Al sumar el número de peldaños al de escaleras y a la plataforma superior, obtenemos los 365 días que tiene el año según nuestro calendario.

TEXT.English: [TAB]It could be said that early China created and then mastered the art of bureaucracy. A huge country spread over a large portion of the world requires a huge number of functionaries to run it, and this was especially true in the days before electronic communication: some Chinese cities were hundreds - even thousands - of miles from the capital.[PARAGRAPH:2]Chinese cities were often run by governors, appointed officials with authority over the local government, judiciary and military. The exact amount of autonomy these officials possessed varied greatly by time and location - during the Warring States period, for example, a number of kingdoms made great efforts to curtail the power of local governments and return power to the central government, as some local officials had become far too autonomous - and corrupt.[PARAGRAPH:2]Governors' palaces housed a large portion of a cities government. They were often large, ornate buildings, lavishly constructed to best display the governments' power and wealth to overawe the local populace. The governor might reside in the palace itself, or have a lavish residence nearby. In addition to the governor's offices, the palace would contain the governor's treasury, offices for bureaucrats and tax collectors, courtrooms, guards' quarters and perhaps jail cells. Depending upon local conditions the palace might be heavily-fortified.
TEXT.French: [TAB]On pourrait dire que dès ses débuts, la Chine a su mettre en place une bureaucratie dont elle a ensuite parfaitement maîtrisé l'art. La gestion d'un immense pays étendu sur une vaste partie du monde requiert de très nombreux fonctionnaires, ce qui était particulièrement vrai avant l'avènement des communications électroniques. En effet, certaines villes chinoises se trouvaient à des centaines, voire à des milliers de kilomètres de la capitale.[PARAGRAPH:2]Les villes chinoises étaient souvent dirigées par des gouverneurs, qui étaient des fonctionnaires que le pouvoir central chargeait de s'occuper du gouvernement, de la justice et de l'armée au niveau local. Le degré exact d'autonomie de ces fonctionnaires variait en fonction de l'époque et du lieu. Ainsi, pendant la période des Royaumes combattants, plusieurs royaumes oeuvrèrent beaucoup pour réduire le pouvoir des gouvernements locaux et le restituer au gouvernement central, car certains fonctionnaires locaux étaient devenus bien trop autonomes, et corrompus.[PARAGRAPH:2]Les palais des gouverneurs abritaient une grande partie du gouvernement de la ville. Il s'agissait souvent de grands bâtiments richement ornés et de constructions luxueuses afin de montrer au mieux le pouvoir et la richesse du gouvernement à la population locale. Le gouverneur pouvait résider dans le palais même ou dans une résidence haut de gamme à proximité. Outre les bureaux du gouverneur, le palais abritait également la trésorerie du gouverneur, les bureaux des fonctionnaires et des percepteurs, les tribunaux, les quartiers des gardes et parfois même des cellules de prisonniers. Si les circonstances locales l'exigeaient, d'imposantes fortifications pouvaient entourer le palais.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Man vermutet, dass die Chinesen die Ersten waren, die bereits sehr früh die Kunst der Bürokratie entwickelten. Ein derart weitläufiges Land, das sich über einen großen Teil des Erdballs erstreckt, erfordert eine gewaltige Zahl an Beamten, um es zu verwalten. Dies galt vor allem in einer Zeit, in der es noch keine auf elektronischen Systemen basierte Kommunikationstechnik gab und manche chinesischen Städte Hunderte, wenn nicht gar Tausende von Kilometern von ihrer Hauptstadt entfernt waren.[PARAGRAPH:2]Die Städte Chinas wurden oft von Statthaltern regiert, die in das Amt berufen wurden und Befehlsgewalt über die Regierung, die Gerichtsbarkeit und die Streitkräfte der Region ausübten. Wie autonom diese Beamten tatsächlich agieren konnten, war vom jeweiligen Zeitalter und der Region abhängig. In der "Zeit der Streitenden Reiche" waren jedenfalls eine Reihe von Königreichen sehr bemüht, den Einflussbereich der regionalen Regierungen erheblich zu beschneiden und stattdessen an die Zentralregierung zurückzuleiten, weil einige der Beamten vor Ort deutlich zu autonom und korrput geworden waren.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ein Großteil der städtischen Regierungsorgane war in den Statthalterpalästen untergebracht. Hierbei handelte es sich meist um große, kunstvoll verzierte Prachtbauten, welche die Macht und den Reichtum der Regierung in beeindruckender Weise widerspiegelten - und so nicht zuletzt auch die regionale Bevölkerung einschüchtern sollten. Der Statthalter selbst wohnte entweder ebenfalls im Regierungspalast oder er unterhielt eine eigene, nicht minder stattliche Residenz in der näheren Umgebung. Neben dem Amtssitz des Statthalters waren im Palastgebäude auch die Schatzkammern der Regierung untergebracht sowie die Amtsräume von Beamten und Steuereintreibern, Gerichtssäle, Wachquartiere und gegebenenfalls Gefängniszellen. Zudem war es, je nach den regionalen Gegebenheiten, schwer befestigt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Si può affermare che fu l'antica Cina a creare e sviluppare l'arte della burocrazia. Un Paese immenso esteso su un vasto territorio necessita di un gran numero di funzionari per essere governato, soprattutto prima dell'avvento dell'era della comunicazione elettronica: alcune città cinesi erano distanti centinaia o migliaia di chilometri dalla capitale.[PARAGRAPH:2]Le città cinesi erano spesso rette da un governatore, un ufficiale di nomina a capo dell'esercito, della giustizia e del governo locale. L'autonomia concessa ai governatori varia a seconda dell'epoca e della località: durante il periodo degli stati belligeranti, per esempio, molti regni cercarono di ridurre l'autonomia delle periferie a favore del governo centrale, visto che molti ufficiali erano diventati troppo autonomi... e corrotti.[PARAGRAPH:2]Il palazzo del governatore era la sede di buona parte dell'amministrazione cittadina. Si trattava spesso di grandi edifici, sfarzosamente decorati per mostrare la ricchezza e la potenza dell'autorità e intimidire la popolazione. Il governatore viveva nel palazzo stesso o in una residenza sfarzosa nei suoi pressi. Oltre agli uffici del governatore, il palazzo ospitava la tesoreria, gli uffici dei burocrati e degli esattori, le aule giudiziarie, gli alloggi delle guardie e a volte anche le prigioni. A seconda delle condizioni locali, i palazzi potevano anche essere pesantemente fortificati.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Puede afirmarse que la China antigua creó, y más tarde dominó, el arte de la burocracia. Un país inmenso que se extiende a lo largo de una parte importante del mundo requiere una enorme cantidad de funcionarios para gobernarse, especialmente en los tiempos anteriores a las comunicaciones electrónicas: algunas ciudades chinas se encontraban a cientos o incluso miles de kilómetros de la capital.[PARAGRAPH:2]Normalmente, las ciudades chinas eran dirigidas por gobernadores, funcionarios con autoridad sobre el gobierno local, los tribunales y el ejército. El grado exacto de autonomía poseída por estos funcionarios variaba en gran medida en función del tiempo y el lugar del que hablemos. Por ejemplo, durante el período de los "estados en guerra", varios reinos hicieron esfuerzos por reducir el poder de los gobiernos locales y devolvérselo a la administración central, puesto que algunos funcionarios se habían vuelto demasiado autónomos... y demasiado corruptos.[PARAGRAPH:2]Los palacios de los gobernadores albergaban gran parte del gobierno de una ciudad. A menudo eran edificios grandes y ostentosos, cuya construcción opulenta pretendía exhibir el poder y la riqueza del gobierno para asombro de la población. El gobernador podía vivir en el propio palacio o en una lujosa residencia de las proximidades. Además de las oficinas del gobernador, el palacio contenía la tesorería, las oficinas de los burócratas y los recaudadores de impuestos, la sala del tribunal, las dependencias de la guardia y hasta puede que la cárcel. En función de las condiciones locales, podía estar muy bien fortificado.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Taixue (literally "Greatest Study or Learning"), or sometimes called the "Imperial Academy", "Imperial School", "Imperial University" or "Imperial Central University", was the highest rank of educational establishment in Ancient China between the Han Dynasty and Sui Dynasty. It was replaced by the Guozijian. The first nationwide government school system in China was established in 3 AD under Emperor Ping of Han, with the taixue located in the capital of Chang'an and local schools established in the prefectures and in the main cities of the smaller counties.[PARAGRAPH:1]Taixue taught Confucianism and Chinese literature among other things for the high level civil service, although a civil service system based upon examination rather than recommendation was not introduced until the Sui and not perfected until the Song Dynasty (960-1279).

[TAB]A "pavilion" is a covered building without surrounding walls (think of it as a roof supported by columns). This kind of structure has been extremely popular for centuries in China, where they are often found in parks and gardens as well as in temple complexes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The first Chinese pavilions were probably constructed during the "Zhou dynasty," and they became quite numerous during the Warring States Period (approximately 400-200 BC). At first these buildings may have been used as watchtowers, providing soldiers with an uninterrupted 360-degree view along with shelter from rain and snow, but in later periods they were incorporated into Chinese gardens and parks, where they were prized for their elegance and simplicity of design.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un "pavillon" est un édifice couvert sans murs autour (soit un toit soutenu par des colonnes). Ce type de structure est resté populaire pendant des siècles en Chine. On les trouve souvent dans les parcs et les jardins, mais également dans les complexes de temples.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Les premiers pavillons chinois sont certainement construits sous la "dynastie Zhou", et se multiplient durant la période des Royaumes combattants (vers 400-200 av. J.-C.). On suppose que ces bâtiments servent au départ de tours de guet, permettant aux soldats d'avoir une vue à 360 degrés, tout en étant protégés des intempéries. Par la suite, ils apparaissent dans les parcs et les jardins chinois, dans lesquels ils sont admirés pour leur conception élégante et discrète.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein "Pavillon" ist ein überdachtes Bauwerk mit einer rundum verlaufenden offenen Stützenkonstruktion (das Dach wird von Pfeilern gehalten). Derartige Gebäude waren in China, wo sie häufig in Parks und Gärten sowie Tempeln zu finden waren, Jahrhunderte lang sehr populär.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Man nimmt an, dass die ersten chinesischen Pavillons während der "Zhou-Dynastie" errichtet und in der "Zeit der Streitenden Reiche (etwa um 400 bis 200 vor Christus) um etliche weitere ergänzt wurden. Anfangs könnten sie als Wachtürme benutzt worden sein, die Soldaten einen 360-Grad-Rundumblick ermöglichten und ihnen zugleich Schutz vor Regen und Schnee boten. In späteren Perioden wurden die Pavillons vorwiegend in chinesische Gärten und Parks integriert, wo sie wegen ihrer eleganten und zugleich zurückhaltend einfachen Optik hoch geschätzt wurden.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il "padiglione" è un edificio coperto privo di muri (lo si può immaginare come un tetto sorretto da colonne). Queste strutture furono molto popolari in Cina, dove si trovano spesso nei parchi e nei giardini, oltre che nei complessi religiosi.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I primi padiglioni cinesi furono probabilmente costruiti sotto la dinastia Zhou. I padiglioni si diffusero enormemente durante il Periodo dei Regni Combattenti (dal 400 al 200 a.C. circa). All'inizio questi edifici erano forse usati come torri di guardia, dato che fornivano ai soldati una visuale ininterrotta di 360 gradi e riparo dalla pioggia e dalla neve, ma in seguito furono eretti anche nei parchi e nei giardini, dove venivano apprezzati per la loro eleganza e per la semplicità.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Un pabellón es un edificio cubierto sin paredes que lo rodeen (piensa en él como en un techo sostenido por columnas). Esta clase de edificio ha sido muy popular en China, donde se suele encontrar en parques y jardines, así como en los complejos de templos.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Los primeros pabellones chinos se construyeron probablemente durante la dinastía Zhou y se hicieron muy numerosos durante el periodo de los Estados en Guerra (aproximadamente entre el 400 y el 200 a. C.). Es posible que al principio estos edificios cumplieran la función de atalayas, pues proporcionaban a los soldados una vista de 360 grados y un refugio contra la nieve y la lluvia, pero en periodos posteriores se incorporaron a los jardines chinos, donde eran apreciados por su elegancia y la sencillez de su diseño.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The CN Tower is a 553 m-high (1,815 ft) concrete communications and observation tower in Downtown Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Built on the former Railway Lands, it was completed in 1976, becoming the world's tallest free-standing structure and world's tallest tower at the time. It held both records for 34 years until the completion of Burj Khalifa and Canton Tower in 2010. It remains the tallest free-standing structure in the Western Hemisphere, a signature icon of Toronto's skyline, and a symbol of Canada, attracting more than two million international visitors annually.[PARAGRAPH:1]Its name "CN" originally referred to Canadian National, the railway company that built the tower. Following the railway's decision to divest non-core freight railway assets, prior to the company's privatization in 1995, it transferred the tower to the Canada Lands Company, a federal Crown corporation responsible for real estate development. Since the name CN Tower became common in daily usage, the abbreviation was eventually expanded to Canadian National Tower or Canada's National Tower. However, neither of these names is commonly used.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1995, the CN Tower was declared one of the modern Seven Wonders of the World by the American Society of Civil Engineers. It also belongs to the World Federation of Great Towers, where it holds second-place ranking.

[TAB]Coal has been used sporadically as a fuel since ancient times, but it was not until the Industrial Revolution that the industrial applications of coal became understood. Most early factories used coal as a power supply, burning the fossil fuel to release the energy needed to drive the plant's machines. Coal power provided much more energy than relying on the strength of humans or animals, at the cost of releasing large amounts of toxic pollution into the atmosphere. Despite the environmental hazards associated with coal plants, they remain common today.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le charbon est utilisé sporadiquement comme combustible depuis les temps anciens mais ce n'est qu'à partir de la révolution industrielle que l'on comprend son importance dans les applications industrielles. La majorité des premières usines utilisent le charbon comme source d'énergie, cette énergie fossile étant brûlée afin de dégager l'énergie nécessaire au fonctionnement des machines. L'énergie fournie par le charbon est bien plus importante que celle fournie par la force des hommes ou des animaux mais elle entraîne l'émission de fumées toxiques polluantes dans l'atmosphère. En dépit des risques environnementaux associés aux usines à charbon, ces dernières sont encore courantes aujourd'hui.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Kohle wurde bereits im Altertum sporadisch als fossiler Brennstoff eingesetzt. Allerdings erkannten die Menschen ihre Bedeutung erst während der Industriellen Revolution. In der Anfangszeit der Industrialisierung nutzten die meisten Fabriken Kohle als Energiequelle für ihre Maschinen. Energie aus der Verbrennung von Kohle war der Körperkraft von Mensch und Tier deutlich überlegen. Trotz der enormen Umweltbelastungen sind Kohlekraftwerke bis heute weit verbreitet.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Nell'antichità il carbone è stato usato sporadicamente come combustibile, ma è solo con la Rivoluzione Industriale che si capirono le possibili applicazioni industriali di questo minerale. La maggior parte delle prime fabbriche utilizzava il carbone come combustibile primario, bruciando il fossile per produrre l'energia necessaria al funzionamento dello stabilimento. L'energia del carbone era maggiore e più affidabile di quella prodotta dagli esseri umani e dagli animali: unico problema, l'inquinamento atmosferico. Malgrado i rischi ambientali, le centrali a carbone sono tutt'oggi abbastanza diffuse.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El carbón se había utilizado esporádicamente como combustible desde la antigüedad pero no fue hasta la Revolución Industrial que empezaron a comprenderse sus aplicaciones industriales. Casi todas las primeras fábricas utilizaban el carbón como fuente energética y quemaban el combustible fósil para proporcionar la energía que necesitaban las máquinas de las plantas. La alimentación con carbón proporcionaba mucha más energía que la fuerza humana o animal, al precio de liberar grandes cantidades de polución tóxica a la atmósfera. Las centrales térmicas siguen siendo comunes hoy en día pese a los peligros medioambientales que suponen.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Hacienda is a Spanish word for an estate. Some haciendas were plantations, mines or factories. Many haciendas combined these productive activities. The hacienda aimed for self-sufficiency in everything but luxuries meant for display, which were destined for the handful of people in the circle of the patrón, also known as the hacendado.[PARAGRAPH:1]Haciendas originated in land grants, mostly made to conquistadors. It is in Mexico that the hacienda system can be considered to have its origin in 1529, when the Spanish crown granted to Hernán Cortés the title of Marquess of the Valley of Oaxaca, which entailed a tract of land that included all of the present state of Morelos. Significantly, Cortés was also granted an encomienda, which included all the Native Americans then living on the land, and with power of life and death every person on his domains.

[TAB]An amphitheatre is an open-air venue used for entertainment, performances, and sports.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ancient Greek theatres were built in a semicircle, with tiered seating above a performance area. Ancient Roman amphitheatres were oval or circular in plan, with seating tiers that surrounded the central performance area, like a modern open-air stadium. Modern usage for "amphitheatre" is lax, and does not always respect the ancient usage, and so the word can be found describing theatre-style stages with the audience only on one side, theatres in the round, and stadiums. Natural formations shaped like man-made theatres are sometimes known as natural amphitheatres. The three largest Roman amphitheatres (in the original sense) in the world in order of size are the Colosseum, the Amphitheatre Campania and the Amphitheatre of El Djem.

[TAB]The Colossus of Rhodes was a bronze statue of Helios, the Greek God of the Sun, erected near the mouth of the city harbor. It stood over 100 feet high, about two-thirds the height of the Statue of Liberty. Unfortunately, an earthquake toppled it only 56 years after its construction. Taking the counsel of an oracle, the city elected to leave the statue where it lay. For over 900 years, people from all over the ancient world came to Rhodes to see the Colossus. It remained where it was until 654 AD when the Muslims who plundered the city sold the statue for scrap.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le colosse de Rhodes était une statue de bronze d'Hélios, le roi grec du soleil, érigée à proximité de l'embouche du port de la ville. Elle s'élevait à 32 m, soit les deux tiers de la Statue de la Liberté, avant d'être malheureusement renversée par un tremblement de terre 56 ans après sa construction. Sur le conseil d'un oracle, la ville avait décidé de la laisser là où elle se trouvait. Pendant plus de 900 ans, des personnes originaires de tout le monde antique venaient à Rhodes pour voir le colosse. Il est resté intact jusqu'en 654 ap. J.-C., lorsque les musulmans pillèrent la ville et se débarrassèrent de la statue.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Koloss von Rhodos war eine Bronzestatue des griechischen Sonnengottes Helios, die nahe der Hafeneinfahrt der Stadt errichtet wurde. Die Statue war über 33 Meter hoch, was in etwa zwei Drittel der Höhe der amerikanischen Freiheitsstatue entspricht. Leider stürzte sie nach nur 56 Jahren bei einem Erdbeben ein. Nach Befragung eines Orakels entschieden die Stadtoberen, die Trümmer der Statue dort zu lassen, wo sie waren. Mehr als 900 Jahre lang kamen Besucher aus der gesamten antiken Welt nach Rhodos, um den Koloss zu sehen, bis seine Überreste im Jahre 654 von plündernden Moslems nach Syrien verschleppt und als Schrott verkauft wurden.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il Colosso di Rodi era una statua di bronzo raffigurante Elios, il dio del sole Greco, eretta all'imboccatura del porto della città. Questa poderosa opera si innalzava per oltre 30 metri, circa due terzi della Statua della Libertà. Disgraziatamente, fu abbattuta da un terremoto 56 anni dopo la sua costruzione e i cittadini, seguendo il volere dell'oracolo, la lasciarono in quello stato. Per 900 anni, pellegrini provenienti da tutte le terre del mondo antico giunsero a Rodi per ammirare il colosso caduto. I suoi resti rimasero sul posto fino al 654 d. C., quando fu distrutto e venduto a pezzi da razziatori Musulmani.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El Coloso de Rodas era una estatua de bronce de Helios, el dios griego del sol, erigida cerca de la boca del puerto de la ciudad. Tenía más de treinta metros de altura, aproximadamente dos tercios de la altura de la Estatua de la Libertad. Por desgracia, fue derribado por un terremoto solo cincuenta y seis años después de su construcción. Siguiendo el consejo de un oráculo, la ciudad decidió dejar la estatua donde había caído. Durante más de novecientos años, gente de todo el mundo fue a Rodas para ver el Coloso. Se quedó donde estaba hasta el año 654 d. C., cuando los musulmanes que saquearon la ciudad la vendieron como chatarra.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The largest and oldest Temple of Confucius is found in Confucius' hometown, present-day Qufu in Shandong Province. It was established in 479 BC, one year after Confucius's death, at the order of the Duke Ai of the State of Lu, who commanded that the Confucian residence should be used to worship and offer sacrifice to Confucius. The temple was expanded repeatedly over a period of more than 2,000 years until it became the huge complex currently standing.[PARAGRAPH:1]The development of state temples devoted to the cult of Confucius was an outcome of his gradual canonisation. In 195 BC, Han Gao Zu, founder of the Han Dynasty (r. 206-195 BC), offered a sacrifice to the spirit of Confucius at his tomb in Qufu. Sacrifices to the spirit of Confucius and that of Yan Hui, his most prominent disciple, began in the Imperial University (Biyong) as early as 241.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 454, the Liu Song dynasty (420 to 479) of southern China built a prominent state Confucian temple. In 489, the Northern Wei constructed a Confucian temple in the capital, the first outside of Qufu in the north. In 630, the Tang Dynasty decreed that schools in all provinces and counties should have a Confucian temple, as a result of which temples spread throughout China. Well-known Confucian shrines include the Confucian Temple in Jianshui, the Confucian Temple in Xi'an (now the Forest of Steles), the Fuzi Miao in Nanjing, and the Confucian Temple in Beijing, first built in 1302. The Confucian Temple of old Tianjin is located on Dongmennei Dajie, a short distance west of Traditional Culture Street (Gu Wenhua Jie). Occupying 32 acres of land, The Confucian Temple is the largest extant traditional architectural complex in Tianjin.[PARAGRAPH:1]In addition to Confucian temples associated with the state cult of Confucius, there were also ancestral temples belonging to the Kong lineage, buildings commemorating Confucius' deeds throughout China, and private temples within academies.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Bon nombre des premiers édifices confucianistes ont été détruits sous la dynastie Qin. Lorsque l'empereur Wudi (140-87 av. J.-C.) adopte le confucianisme comme religion d'Etat en Chine, il nomme de nombreux érudits confucianistes à des postes de pouvoir. La connaissance du confucianisme finit par devenir un préalable pour espérer travailler pour le gouvernement impérial. Des académies confucianistes publiques et privées sont apparues partout en Chine. C'est là que les familles envoyaient leurs fils étudier pour passer les examens de la fonction publique.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Viele frühe konfuzianische Gebäude wurden während der Qin-Dynastie zerstört. Als Kaiser Wu (156-87 vor Christus) den Konfuzianismus als Staatsreligion annahm, berief er unzählige Anhänger des Konfuzianismus in hohe Ämter. Später war der Konfuzianismus sogar die Voraussetzung für eine Beamtenlaufbahn. In ganz China entstanden daraufhin private und öffentliche Akademien, in denen junge Männer auf den Staatsdienst vorbereitet wurden.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Molti dei primi edifici di culto dedicati a Confucio furono distrutti durante la dinastia dei Qin. Quando l'Imperatore Wu (156-87 BC) scelse come religione ufficiale della Cina il Confucianesimo, gli anziani di questa religione vennero messi in posizioni di potere. Successivamente, la conoscenza del Confucianesimo divenne una prerogativa necessaria per potere entrare a far parte del governo Imperiale. Le accademie del Confucianesimo, private e pubbliche, si diffusero rapidamente in tutta la Cina: qui le famiglie mandavano i propri figli a studiare per poter partecipare agli esami statali.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Muchos de los edificios confucionistas más antiguos fueron destruidos en tiempos de la dinastía Qin. Cuando el emperador Wu (156-87 a. C.) adoptó el confucianismo como religión de estado en China, colocó a muchos de sus seguidores en posiciones de poder; con el tiempo, el conocimiento de esta religión se convirtió en un requisito para cualquiera que aspirase a conseguir un puesto en la burocracia imperial. Por toda China aparecieron academias confucionistas públicas y privadas, adonde las familias enviaban a sus hijos para preparar los exámenes de ingreso en la administración civil.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The shuyuan originated in 725 during the Tang dynasty. They were places where scholars could teach and study the classics, and where books collected from around the country could be preserved. By the late Tang dynasty, private academies had appeared all over China.[PARAGRAPH:1]During the Northern Song (960-1127), many academies were established with government encouragement. Each academy had its own teaching and administrative structure and was economically independent.[PARAGRAPH:1]Besides signboards, emperors also bestowed books. In 977, the Taizong Emperor bestowed on the White Deer Grotto Academy a copy of the Nine Confucian Classics printed by the Guozijian. The Yuelu Academy, the Songyang Academy and other academies also received books from the Emperor on a number of occasions.[PARAGRAPH:1]However, academies had begun to decline by the 12th century. The White Deer Grotto Academy, which had fallen into ruin, was rebuilt by the prominent neo-Confucianist Zhu Xi in 1179-80 during the Southern Song dynasty and reopened in 1180. It became an important center of Confucian thought during eight centuries. Zhu Xi himself taught here during the Southern Song as did Wang Yangming during the Ming. As a result of Zhu Xi's efforts, the shuyuan became a permanent feature of Chinese education, taking up major responsibilities of local education.[PARAGRAPH:1]The system of academies was dismantled under the Yuan Dynasty (1271-1368) and all academies were placed under government control to became preparatory schools for the Imperial Examinations. However, the system was revived under the Ming (1368-1644) and the Qing (1644-1911).[PARAGRAPH:1]In the Ming dynasty, academies devoted to discussing political issues appeared, such as the Donglin Academy, often resulting in political repression. According to one study, 40% of the 1239 known Ming academies were built during the Jiajing era (1522-1566). During the Qing dynasty, thousands of academies were created for the purpose of preparing students for the Imperial Examination, although there were still some that functioned as centers of study and research.[PARAGRAPH:1]The academies were finally abolished under the Hundred Days' Reform in 1898 at the end of the Qing dynasty.[PARAGRAPH:1]There were more than 7,000 academies recorded. In the late Qing dynasty, some became universities, middle schools, public libraries and museums.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un monastère est un édifice dans lequel les moines peuvent se retirer du monde et se concentrer sur le divin. Généralement, les règles de conduite y sont strictes afin de protéger ses membres, détachés du monde, de la tentation. Dans certains monastères, les moines sont totalement silencieux ; dans d'autres, les visiteurs ne sont pas autorisés à pénétrer dans leur enceinte. Les monastères ont généralement de nombreux rituels et services religieux quotidiens.[PARAGRAPH:1]A travers les siècles, les monastères ont souvent été des centres d'érudition. Dans les zones retirées, les moines étaient parfois les seules personnes sachant lire et écrire à des kilomètres à la ronde. Ils ont souvent servi de scribes, recopiant les textes sacrés de leur religion. Les monastères ont généralement de grandes bibliothèques possédant des textes religieux, scientifiques, médicaux et philosophiques.[PARAGRAPH:1]Pendant des siècles, le confucianisme a été la religion d'Etat en Chine et la cour impériale nommait régulièrement des confucianistes à des postes d'autorité et de pouvoir. Ainsi, de nombreux monastères confucianistes ont été construits avec le soutien impérial.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Klöster sind Gebäude, in die sich Mönche zurückziehen, um sich auf Gott zu konzentrieren. In Klöstern gelten strenge Verhaltensregeln, die die Mönche vor Versuchungen bewahren sollen. In einigen Klöstern herrscht ein strenges Redeverbot, in anderen sind keine Besucher gestattet. Die Mönche selbst gehen täglich ihren religiösen Pflichten nach.[PARAGRAPH:1]In der Vergangenheit waren Klöster stets auch Zentren des Wissens. In abgelegenen Gegenden waren die Mönche oft die einzigen gebildeten Menschen, die als Schreiber ihre religiösen Schriften kopierten. Klöster haben nicht selten Bibliotheken, in denen unzählige religiöse, wissenschaftliche, medizinische und philosophische Texte aufbewahrt werden.[PARAGRAPH:1]Jahrhundertelang war der Konfuzianismus die Staatsreligion Chinas. Am kaiserlichen Hof lebten stets hochrangige und mächtige Anhänger des Konfuzianismus. Nicht zuletzt deshalb wurden zahlreiche konfuzianische Klöster unter kaiserlichem Patronat errichtet.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il monastero è un edificio nel quale i monaci possono ritirarsi dal mondo e concentrarsi sul Divino. In genere, nel monastero vige un regolamento ferreo per proteggere i membri della comunità dalle tentazioni. In alcuni monasteri, i monaci erano completamente silenziosi e non erano permesse visite dall'esterno per non interrompere i rituali quotidiani e le cerimonie religiose.[PARAGRAPH:1] Nel corso dei secoli, i monasteri sono stati spesso centro di insegnamento: in alcune zone, i monaci erano sovente gli unici in grado di leggere e scrivere nel giro di diversi chilometri. Da sempre, i monaci sono stati utilizzati come scribi per copiare le parole sacre della propria religione; i monasteri ospitavano spesso delle biblioteche che contenevano testi religiosi, scientifici, medici e filosofici.[PARAGRAPH:1]Per secoli, il Confucianesimo è stato la religione ufficiale della Cina e nella Corte Imperiale erano spesso presenti membri di questa dottrina in posizioni di autorità a e potere. Per questo motivo, molti monasteri dediti al Confucianesimo furono costruiti con le sovvenzioni governative.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Un monasterio es un edificio en el que los monjes pueden retirarse del mundo para concentrarse en los asuntos de la divinidad. Normalmente tienen estrictas reglas de comportamiento para proteger a sus miembros de la tentación. En algunos monasterios, los monjes guardan un silencio total, mientras que en otros no se permite el acceso a los visitantes. Lo habitual es que sus miembros tengan que celebrar a diario muchos rituales y servicios religiosos.[PARAGRAPH:1] A lo largo de la historia, los monasterios han sido muchas veces centros de estudio. En las regiones remotas, los monjes podían ser las únicas personas letradas en muchos kilómetros a la redonda. A menudo han sido empleados como escribas, y se han dedicado a copiar los textos sagrados de su religión. Normalmente cuentan con grandes bibliotecas, que contienen textos religiosos, científicos, médicos y filosóficos.[PARAGRAPH:1]Durante siglos, el confucianismo fue la religión de estado en China, y la corte imperial contaba siempre con confucionistas en posiciones de autoridad y poder. Por ello, muchos templos confucionistas se construyeron bajo auspicios imperiales.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Kong Lin is a cemetery of the Kong clan (the descendants of Confucius) in Confucius' hometown Qufu in Shandong province. Confucius himself and some of his disciples are buried there, as well as many thousands of his descendants.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1331 construction work began on the wall and gate of the cemetery. In total, the cemetery has undergone 13 renovations and extensions. Eventually, by the late 18th century, the perimeter wall reached a length of 7.5 kilometres (4.7 mi), enclosing an area of 3.6 square kilometres (1.4 sq mi). In this space, the tombs of more than 100,000 descendants of Confucius, who have been buried there over a period of about 2,000 years, can be found. The oldest graves date back to the Zhou Dynasty, the most recent of which belong to descendants in the 76th and 78th generation.[PARAGRAPH:1]The cemetery suffered serious damage in November 1966, during the Cultural Revolution, when it was visited and vandalized by a team of Red Guards from Beijing Normal University, led by Tan Houlan. The corpse of the 76th-generation Duke Yansheng was removed from its grave and hung naked from a tree in front of the palace during the desecration of the cemetery in the Cultural Revolution.

[TAB]A Wen Miao is a temple devoted to the worship of Confucius as the Wéndì (God of Culture). The largest and oldest Temple of Confucius is found in Confucius' hometown, present-day Qufu in Shandong Province. It was established in 479 BC, one year after Confucius's death, at the order of the Duke Ai of the State of Lu, who commanded that the Confucian residence should be used to worship and offer sacrifice to Confucius. The temple was expanded repeatedly over a period of more than 2,000 years until it became the huge complex currently standing.[PARAGRAPH:1]The development of state temples devoted to the cult of Confucius was an outcome of his gradual canonisation. In 195 BC, Han Gao Zu, founder of the Han Dynasty (r. 206-195 BC), offered a sacrifice to the spirit of Confucius at his tomb in Qufu. Sacrifices to the spirit of Confucius and that of Yan Hui, his most prominent disciple, began in the Imperial University (Biyong) as early as 241.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 454, the Liu Song dynasty (420 to 479) of southern China built a prominent state Confucian temple. In 489, the Northern Wei constructed a Confucian temple in the capital, the first outside of Qufu in the north. In 630, the Tang Dynasty decreed that schools in all provinces and counties should have a Confucian temple, as a result of which temples spread throughout China. Well-known Confucian shrines include the Confucian Temple in Jianshui, the Confucian Temple in Xi'an (now the Forest of Steles), the Fuzi Miao in Nanjing, and the Confucian Temple in Beijing, first built in 1302. The Confucian Temple of old Tianjin is located on Dongmennei Dajie, a short distance west of Traditional Culture Street (Gu Wenhua Jie). Occupying 32 acres of land, The Confucian Temple is the largest extant traditional architectural complex in Tianjin.[PARAGRAPH:1]In addition to Confucian temples associated with the state cult of Confucius, there were also ancestral temples belonging to the Kong lineage, buildings commemorating Confucius' deeds throughout China, and private temples within academies.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Bien que Confucius ait davantage été un philosophe qu'un leader religieux, il est progressivement devenu un dieu et est vénéré partout en Asie. De nombreux temples ont été édifiés en son honneur, certains petits et privés, d'autres plus grands dans lesquels des centaines de fidèles peuvent assister aux services religieux. De nombreux temples confucianistes ont été construits dans le style architectural de la pagode.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Obwohl Konfuzius selbst eher ein Philosoph als ein Religionsstifter war, wurde er in weiten Teilen Asiens als Gott verehrt. Damals entstanden unzählige kleine und große Konfuzius-Tempel. Viele dieser Tempel wurden im typischen Pagodenstil erbaut.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Malgrado Confucio fosse più un filosofo che un leader religioso, col tempo divenne una divinità e di conseguenza adorato in tutta l'Asia. Vennero edificati molti templi dedicati a Confucio alcuni piccoli e privati, altri più grandi e in grado di ospitare centinaia di fedeli. Molti templi dedicati a Confucio vennero costruiti imitando lo stile architettonico delle pagode.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Aunque el propio Confucio era más un filósofo que un líder religioso, con el paso del tiempo se le fue atribuyendo condición divina y su culto se extendió por toda Asia. Se construyeron muchos templos en su honor, algunos de ellos pequeños y privados y otros más grandes, donde cientos de fieles podían acudir a las ceremonias. Muchos de estos templos se construyeron siguiendo el modelo arquitectónico de las pagodas.

TEXT.English: [TAB]As kingdoms and empires expanded, it became increasingly difficult for the rulers to maintain control over the more distant regions of their realm. To ensure that the far-flung cities of the empire contributed their expected share of duties and taxes to the government, rulers constructed courthouses to help unify their domains. These local centers of government meted out justice and helped preserve order in the midst of the furthest wilderness.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Avec l'extension des royaumes et des empires, il est devenu extrêmement difficile pour les dirigeants de garder le contrôle des régions de leur royaume les plus excentrées. Pour s'assurer que les cités les plus lointaines de l'empire remplissaient leurs obligations et versaient les taxes dues au gouvernement, les dirigeants ont construit des palais de justice qui ont ainsi contribué à unifier leurs territoires. Ces représentations locales du gouvernement rendaient la justice et maintenaient l'ordre au sein des étendues les plus sauvages.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Je größer ein Reich wurde, desto schwieriger wurde es für den jeweiligen Herrscher, die entlegeneren Gebiete zu kontrollieren. Um sicherzustellen, dass auch die entfernteren Städte des Reiches die von ihnen geforderten Tribute und Steuern an die Staatskasse entrichteten, wurden örtliche Magistrate eingesetzt und Gerichtsgebäude errichtet. Letztere dienten einerseits zur Verkündung und Durchsetzung von Gesetzen zur Regelung des öffentlichen Lebens, während sie andererseits den Bürgern der Stadt auch Gelegenheit boten, den offiziellen Repräsentanten des Staatsoberhaupts ihre Beschwerden vorzutragen. All diese Maßnahmen verringerten die Kriminalität und hielten so die Produktivität der ansässigen Bevölkerung aufrecht.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Man mano che i regni e gli imperi crescevano di dimensione, divenne sempre più difficile per i governanti amministrare lo stato. Fu così che vennero istituiti tribunali locali che consentissero ai magistrati e ai funzionari di controllare le attività che si svolgevano anche nelle località più remote. In questi luoghi si dirimevano le questioni legali legate alla vita di tutti i giorni e ci si occupava di garantire che venissero rispettati gli obblighi delle comunità nei confronti del governo centrale.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]A medida que los reinos y los imperios iban expandiéndose, se hizo más y más difícil para los gobernantes mantener el control sobre las regiones más alejadas de sus estados. Por eso, empezaron a construir delegaciones para unificar sus dominios y asegurar que las ciudades más remotas del imperio contribuyesen con la parte que se esperaba de ellas en cuanto a obligaciones y tareas. Estos centros locales de gobierno impartían justicia y ayudaban a conservar el orden en medio de las tierras menos civilizadas.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Cristo Redentor, "Christ the Redeemer" in English, is a 125-foot tall statue of Jesus Christ situated on Corcovado Mountain, watching over the Brazilian city of Rio de Janeiro. First proposed in 1921 during celebrations of the centennial of Brazilian independence, Cristo Redentor slowly began to take shape through the eyes of potential designers. By 1931, the statue had been completed, making it the largest art deco monument in the world. Since that time, the statue, seated 2330 above sea level, has become an awesome symbol of Rio de Janeiro and of Brazil.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le Christ Rédempteur est une statue haute de 38 mètres, située sur le pic du Corcovado, qui surplombe la ville brésilienne de Rio de Janeiro. Proposé en 1921, à l'occasion des célébrations du centenaire de l'indépendance brésilienne, le Christ Rédempteur commença lentement à prendre forme dans l'esprit de ses sculpteurs. La statue est achevée en 1931, devenant le plus grand monument d'art déco au monde. Depuis cette époque, la statue, située à 700 mètres au-dessus du niveau de la mer, est devenue un extraordinaire symbole de Rio de Janeiro et du Brésil.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Cristo Redentor (dt. "Christus, der Erlöser") ist eine ca. 40 Meter hohe Christusstatue, die sich auf dem Berg Corcovado befindet, mit Blick über die brasilianische Stadt Rio de Janeiro. Erstmals 1921 während der Feierlichkeiten zur 100-jährigen Unabhängigkeit Brasiliens vorgeschlagen, nahm die Christusstatue in den Augen potenzieller Konstrukteure langsam Formen an. 1931 wurde die Statue fertig gestellt, das weltweit größte Monument des Art Déco. Seit damals ist die Statue, die sich 710 Meter über dem Meeresspiegel befindet, ein eindrucksvolles Symbol der Stadt Rio de Janeiro und ganz Brasiliens.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il Cristo Redentore è una statua alta 38 metri di Gesù Cristo, situata in cima alla montagna del Corcovado, che guarda la città brasiliana di Rio de Janeiro. La costruzione fu proposta nel 1921, durante le celebrazioni del centenario dell'indipendenza brasiliana e il Cristo Redentore cominciò lentamente a prendere forma attraverso gli occhi dei potenziali progettisti. La statua fu completata nel 1931 e divenne così il più grande monumento art deco al mondo. Da quel momento la statua, che si trova a 710 metri sul livello del mare, è diventata il simbolo di Rio de Janeiro e del Brasile.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El Cristo Redentor es una estatua de Jesucristo de más de cuarenta metros de altura que se encuentra sobre el monte Corcovado, frente a la ciudad brasileña de Río de Janeiro. Propuesta su construcción por primera vez en 1921, durante las celebraciones del centenario de la independencia de Brasil, el Cristo Redentor empezó a tomar forma poco a poco en las mentes de sus potenciales diseñadores. En 1931, una vez terminado, se convirtió en el monumento art decó más grande del mundo. Desde entonces, esta obra, situada casi setecientos metros por encima del nivel del mar, se ha convertido en el máximo y más imponente símbolo de Río de Janeiro y de Brasil.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A Customs House is an organization responsible for collecting taxes on imports or exports, as well as for seizing contraband. Customs Houses were common during the Age of Sail, when the level of trade skyrocketed and the necessity for a centralized system of tax collection arose. In Spain, with the huge influx of wealth from the New World, Sevilla was designated the "Customs City" where all transports carrying Incan or Aztec gold were required to land so that the Crown could take its share. Tariffs became a hotly-debated topic in the New World, especially in the English colonies, where tariffs would fan the flames of several of that region's most violent conflicts.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le poste de douane est l'organisation chargée de collecter des taxes sur les importations ou les exportations, ainsi que de saisir les produits de contrebande. Les postes de douane sont courants pendant la période des grandes explorations, alors même que le niveau des échanges commerciaux grimpe en flèche et que la nécessité d'un système centralisé pour la collecte des taxes commence à se faire sentir. Avec l'immense influx de richesses en provenance du Nouveau monde, l'Espagne a l'idée de désigner Séville "ville des douanes" et d'obliger tous les navires transportant de l'or inca ou aztèque à s'y arrêter, afin que la couronne puisse prélever sa part. Les tarifs douaniers deviennent un sujet de débat brûlant au sein du Nouveau monde, surtout dans les colonies anglaises, où ils vont attiser des conflits extrêmement violents.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Zollamt ist eine Institution, die dafür zuständig ist, Steuern auf Importe und Exporte zu erheben und Schmuggelware zu beschlagnahmen. Zollämter gab es häufig im Zeitalter der Entdeckungen, als das Handelsvolumen in die Höhe schoss und die Notwendigkeit für ein zentrales Steuererhebungssystem entstand. In Spanien, mit dem großen Einfluss des Reichtums aus der Neuen Welt, wurde Sevilla zur Zollstadt ernannt, und alle Transporte mit Gold der Inkas oder Azteken mussten hier Halt machen, um der Krone ihren Anteil abzutreten. Zolltarife wurden zu einem heiß diskutierten Thema in der Neuen Welt, speziell in den englischen Kolonien, wo die Gebühren einige der gewaltsamsten Konflikte der Region schürten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La Dogana è un'organizzazione responsabile della riscossione delle tasse su importazioni ed esportazioni, oltre che della confisca delle merci di contrabbando. Le Dogane erano comuni durante l'era della navigazione a vela, quando il livello del commercio decollò e nacque la necessità di un sistema centralizzato di riscossione delle tasse. In Spagna, con l'enorme flusso di entrate provenienti dal Nuovo Mondo, Sevilla era considerata la "città della Dogana", dove tutte le navi che trasportavano oro inca o azteco dovevano fermarsi affinché la Corona potesse prendere la sua parte. Le tariffe divennero un argomento molto discusso, nel Nuovo Mondo, specialmente nelle colonie inglesi, dove avrebbero alimentato la fiamma di molti dei più violenti conflitti di quella regione.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Las aduanas son las instituciones responsables de cobrar los impuestos a la importación y la exportación, así como de requisar el contrabando. Su uso se generalizó durante la "era de la vela", cuando el volumen de los intercambios mercantiles se elevó exponencialmente y empezó a hacerse sentir la necesidad de un sistema de recaudación centralizado. En España, con la entrada de las enormes riquezas del Nuevo Mundo, Sevilla se convirtió en la "Casa de contratación", a donde debía transportarse todo el oro inca o azteca para que la Corona pudiera quedarse con su parte. Los aranceles y tarifas se convirtieron en objeto de controversia en el Nuevo Mundo, sobre todo en las colonias inglesas, donde provocarían el estallido de algunos de los más violentos conflictos de la región.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Dome of the Rock is located at the visual center of an ancient man-made platform known as the Temple Mount, which Muslims refer to as the "Noble Sanctuary". The platform, greatly enlarged under the rule of Herod the Great, is the site of the Second Jewish Temple which was destroyed during the Roman Siege of Jerusalem in 70 AD. In 637 AD, Jerusalem was conquered by the Rashidun Caliphate army during the Islamic invasion of the Byzantine Empire.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Dome of the Rock was erected between 685 and 691 AD. The names of the two engineers in charge of the project are given as: Yazid Ibn Salam from Jerusalem and Raja Ibn Haywah from Baysan. Umayyad Caliph Abd al-Malik ibn Marwan who initiated construction of the Dome, hoped that it would "house the Muslims from cold and heat" and intended the building to serve as a shrine for pilgrims and not as a mosque for public worship. Historians contend that the Caliph wished to create a structure which would compete with the existing buildings of other religions in the city. al-Maqdisi writes that he "Sought to build for the Muslims a masjid that should be unique and a wonder to the world. And in like manner, is it not evident that Caliph Abd al-Malik, seeing the greatness of the martyrium of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre and its magnificence was moved lest it should dazzle the minds of Muslims and hence erected above the Rock the dome which is now seen there."[PARAGRAPH:1]During the Crusades the Dome of the Rock was given to the Augustinians, who turned it into a church, and the Al-Aqsa Mosque became the royal palace of Baldwin I of Jerusalem in 1104. The Knights Templar, who believed the Dome of the Rock was the site of the Temple of Solomon, set up their headquarters in the Al-Aqsa Mosque adjacent to the Dome for much of the 12th century. The "Templum Domini," as they called it, was featured on the official seals of the Order's Grand Masters, and it became the architectural model for Templar churches across Europe.[PARAGRAPH:1]Jerusalem was recaptured by Saladin on Friday, 2 October 1187 and the Haram was reconsecrated as a Muslim sanctuary. The cross on top of the Dome of the Rock was replaced by a golden crescent and a wooden screen was placed around the rock below. Salah al-Din's nephew al-Malik al-Mu'azzam Isa (615-24/1218-27) carried out other restorations within the Haram and added the porch to the Aqsa mosque.[PARAGRAPH:1]Large-scale renovation was undertaken during the reign of Mahmud II in 1817. Adjacent to the Dome of the Rock, the Ottomans built the free-standing Dome of the Prophet in 1620.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Dome of the Rock was badly shaken during an earthquake in Palestine on Monday, 11 July 1927 rendering useless many of the repairs that had taken place over previous years.[PARAGRAPH:1]Under Jordanian rule of Jerusalem, Jews were forbidden from entering the Old City. Israel took control of the Dome of the Rock during its victory in the Six-Day War in 1967. A few hours after the Israeli flag was hoisted over the Dome of the Rock in 1967, at the conclusion of the Six-Day War, Israelis lowered it on the orders of General Moshe Dayan, and invested the Muslim Waqf (religious trust) with the authority to manage the Temple Mount-Haram al-Sharif in order to "keep the peace".[PARAGRAPH:1]The Dome of the Rock, being among a complex of buildings on the Temple Mount, (the other principal building being the Al-Aqsa Mosque) is one of the holiest sites in Islam, following Mecca, Medina, and, for shia Muslims, the Imam Ali Mosque. Its significance stems from the religious beliefs regarding the rock at its heart. According to Islamic tradition, the rock is the spot from where Muhammad ascended to Heaven accompanied by the angel Gabriel.[PARAGRAPH:1]The stone over which the Muslim shrine, the Dome of Rock, was built is the holiest site in Judaism. Jews have traditionally regarded the location of the stone as the holiest spot on Earth, the site of the Holy of Holies during the Temple Period. In former times, some Jewish scholars thought that the location of the Holy of Holies was not known for certain. Today this is a minority opinion.[PARAGRAPH:1]Just as Muslims pray towards the Kaaba at Mecca, the holiest site in Islam, Jews pray towards the site of the ancient Holy of Holies, the Foundation Stone, the holiest site in Judaism.[PARAGRAPH:1]In Christianity it is believed that during the time of the Byzantine Empire, nearby the spot where the Dome was later constructed was where Constantine's mother built a small church, calling it the Church of St. Cyrus and St. John, later on enlarged and called the Church of the Holy Wisdom. On the walls of the Dome of the Rock is an inscription in a mosaic frieze that includes the following words:[PARAGRAPH:1]"Bless your envoy and your servant Jesus son of Mary and peace upon him on the day of birth and on the day of death and on the day he is raised up again. It is a word of truth in which they doubt. It is not for God to take a son. Glory be to him when he decrees a thing he only says be, and it is."
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Felsendom ist das wohl bekannteste Wahrzeichen Jerusalems und eines der Hauptheiligtümer des Islam. Er befindet sich auf dem Tempelberg im südöstlichen Teil der Altstadt von Jerusalem. Der Felsendom ist der älteste islamische Sakralbau und stellt ein Meisterwerk der islamischen Baukunst des frühen Umayyadenstils dar, in welchem die Übernahme des frühchristlich-byzantinischen Zentralbautyps zum Ausdruck kommt.[PARAGRAPH:1]Der Kuppelbau wurde über dem Felsen (Sachra) errichtet, auf welchem Abraham der biblischen Erzählung nach seinen Sohn Isaak zu opfern bereit war und wo die Himmelfahrt Mohammeds stattgefunden haben soll. Er ist ursprünglich - und auch heute - nicht als Moschee, sondern als ein Schrein beziehungsweise eine Kuppel verstanden worden.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die Erbauung des Felsendoms wird in der neueren Forschung dem Kalifen ?Abd al-Malik ibn Marwan (regierte 685-705) sowie dessen Sohn und Nachfolger al-Walid ibn ?Abd al-Malik (reg. 705-715), der auch den Bau der al-Aqsa-Moschee weitergeführt haben soll, zugeschrieben. Die Bauinschrift in archaischem kufischen Duktus, die über dem Kranzgesims an der Kuppel erhalten ist, dokumentiert nicht nur den Namen des Erbauers, sondern auch die ursprüngliche Bezeichnung der Anlage, die man lediglich als Kuppel (Qubba) verstanden hat; der hier in Klammern stehende Namensteil ist vom Abbasidenkalifen Al-Ma?mun getilgt und durch seinen eigenen Namen ersetzt worden.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A drydock is a facility for constructing and repairing ships. Drydocks may be floating structures or land-based. They contain one or more large bays in which the ship-work is done. These bays are below sea-level and contain drainage systems and water-tight doors. While construction or repairs are going on, the drydock is dry, the vessel sitting on the dock's floor supported by an elaborate structure of scaffolding. When construction or repairs are complete, the dock is flooded and the ship floats gently off the scaffolding. Once the water level inside the dock reaches sea-level, the drydock's doors are opened and the ship can proceed to sea.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une cale sèche est une infrastructure permettant la construction et la réparation de bateaux. Il peut s'agir de structures flottantes ou situées à terre. Elles sont constituées d'un ou plusieurs bassins situés en dessous du niveau de la mer qui comportent des systèmes de drainage et des portes étanches. Lors de la construction ou de la réparation, la cale sèche est vidée de son eau et le bateau est maintenu sur le sol par une structure élaborée d'échafaudage. Lorsque le niveau d'eau dans la cale atteint celui de la mer, les portes de la cale s'ouvrent et le bateau peut prendre la mer.
TEXT.German: [TAB]In Trockendocks werden Schiffe gebaut und repariert. Trockendocks können im Wasser oder an Land errichtet werden. Sie bestehen aus einer oder mehreren Buchten, in denen an einem oder mehreren Schiffen gearbeitet wird. Diese Buchten befinden sich unterhalb des Meeresspiegels und verfügen über Entwässerungssysteme und wasserdichte Tore. Während der Reparatur oder des Baus ist kein Wasser im Trockendock. Das Schiff wird in dieser Zeit durch eine ausgeklügelte Gerüststruktur gestützt. Anschließend wird das Dock geflutet. Ist das Niveau des Meeresspiegels erreicht, werden die Tore des Trockendocks geöffnet und das Schiff kann das Dock verlassen.
